data.job_description:
Job Description React Developer

Position Description
CGI is seeking a Front End Developer with REACT JS Framework with modern software engineering practices (Continuous Integration, Specification by Example, Behavior / Test Driven Development - BDD, TDD) and respective tools, to become a part of a dynamic team.

This is an exciting opportunity to augment your current skills, as well as learn new technologies.

This role can be located in Bloomfield, CT.

Your future duties and responsibilities

• Construct visualizations that are able to smoothly and accurately depict data in web-based user portals.

• Work seamlessly with the rest of the engineering team (e.g. back-end & front-end developers).

• Work with product team and UX designers to understand user interactions and iteratively build customer-facing features.

• Ability to work in an agile environment and Iterate quickly based on customer and internal feedback.

• You'll participate in design discussions, helping us decide our best ways of building new features

• You'll break down, oversee, and deliver stories to advance our product using the Agile SCRUM methodology

• You'll mentor others in your areas of expertise

• You'll collaborate with our QA, DevOps, Product, and Support teams

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

• Demonstrated success in actively contributing to large consulting projects.

• Proven experience with responsive website design

• 5+ year experience with JavaScript / HTML / CSS with 2 years focused in React JS

• Strong Proficiency in & GraphQL

• 3+ year experience of SQL/NoSQL

• Python Experience is Plus

• Experience working on large-scale web initiatives & single page web applications

• Experience with Linux systems (bash), Git, and TDD or basic unit-testing

Desired qualifications/non-essential skills required

• Good hands-on experience in using JavaScript, React JS, API integration.

• Knowledge of Kubernetes, Dockers, Jenkins, CI/CD pipeline and Maven.

• Experience with public APIs and multi-modal services

• Knowledge in using HTML/HTML5, NodeJS, CSS3, JavaScript, type script, React js, and ES6.

• Experience with MonoRepo environment.

• Knowledge of best practices commonly used modules and creating self-contained reusable and testable modules and components.

• Dedicated team player who can lead a project and have worked on large-scale applications.

• Develop test protocols or plan for testing revised application and review test results.

• May mentor less experienced technical staff; may use high end development tools to assist or facilitate development process.

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to: skill set level; experience and training; and licensure and certifications. CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $84,000 - 161,600.

At CGI we call our professionals "members" to reinforce that all who join our team are, as owners, empowered to participate in the challenges and rewards that come from building a world-class company. CGI's benefits include:

• Competitive base salaries

• Eligibility to participate in an attractive Share Purchase Plan (SPP) in which the company matches dollar-for-dollar contributions made by eligible employees, up to a maximum, for their job category

• 401(k) Plan and Profit Participation for eligible members

• Generous holidays, vacation, and sick leave plans

• Comprehensive insurance plans that include, among other benefits, medical, dental, vision, life, disability, out-of-county emergency coverage in all countries of employment;

• Back-up child care, Pet insurance, a Member Assistance Program, a 529 college savings program, a personal financial management tool, lifestyle management programs and more

#DICE
#LI-SG6

Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.

CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.

We make it easy to translate military experience and skills Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.

All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local regulations and ordinances.

CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.

Skills
• CSS
• HTML
• JavaScript
• Node.Js

Proven experience with responsive website design
5+ year experience with JavaScript / HTML / CSS with 2 years focused in React JS
Strong Proficiency in & GraphQL
3+ year experience of SQL/NoSQL
Python Experience is Plus
Experience working on large-scale web initiatives & single page web applications
Experience with Linux systems (bash), Git, and TDD or basic unit-testing
Node.Js
Responsibilities: Construct visualizations that are able to smoothly and accurately depict data in web-based user portals
Work seamlessly with the rest of the engineering team (e.g. back-end & front-end developers)
Work with product team and UX designers to understand user interactions and iteratively build customer-facing features

You'll participate in design discussions, helping us decide our best ways of building new features
You'll break down, oversee, and deliver stories to advance our product using the Agile SCRUM methodology
You'll mentor others in your areas of expertise
You'll collaborate with our QA, DevOps, Product, and Support teams

data.job_description:
About the React/Front-end Developer position

We are looking for an experienced React/JavaScript Developer with a passion for working with and applying new technologies and staying up to speed on the latest and greatest of the fast changing world of front-end development.

The ideal candidate will be someone who prioritizes being part of a team and has a desire to work on medium to long term projects at scale, but embraces the satisfaction of shipping and the challenge of taking on new projects often. A willingness to productively share ideas and knowledge, and work in a mentorship driven culture where they are either in a mentorship role or being mentored is a recipe for success.

Exceptional candidates will have knowledge and/or experience in writing tests for the code they ship and/or some rudimentary understanding of application security as it relates to browser related subjects. If you can jump into the back-end and build out API's and get your hands dirty in the whole stack we love you even more.

An eye for clean and practical user interfaces and experiences is also a bonus.

What makes us stand out?

Sudokrew was founded on a simple but core principle: Build stuff that matters.

We are a blended shop of team augmentation working with top-tier tech companies, but also take the lead on developing greenfield projects in areas like clean energy, as well as build our own products/technologies in the IoT space.

WE INVEST IN PEOPLE regardless of where they are in their career. We believe that building people up is a recipe for success and that an investment in people is an investment in ourselves.

If you don't have all of the criteria listed on this position but you believe that you have the will to succeed, apply anyways. We'd be happy to talk to you and for the right candidates, we are willing to provide a training path prior to employment to fill in the gaps for the specific requirements that we need for you to be successful in what we do.

Front-end Developer responsibilities are:
• Developing component based user interfaces for data-driven applications using modern tooling and best practices
• Optimize applications for maximum speed and design mobile-based features
• Develop quality mockups and prototypes
• Work together with back-end developers and web designers to implement component and product designs
• Write functional requirement documents and guides
• Assist back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting
• Keep in touch with latest trends in web development

Front-end Developer requirements are:
• 2-3 "years" experience of working with React or at least a deep understanding and the ability to build well-designed components
• Significant experience with vanilla JavaScript and CSS
• Excellent understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)
• Knowledge of browser testing and debugging
• Knowledge of browser based application security attacks and mitigation (optional)
• Excellent analytical and multitasking skills with an ability to perform well in a dynamic environment
• Enough of an education to know what you're doing (however you learned to do what you do)

Qualifications: The ideal candidate will be someone who prioritizes being part of a team and has a desire to work on medium to long term projects at scale, but embraces the satisfaction of shipping and the challenge of taking on new projects often
A willingness to productively share ideas and knowledge, and work in a mentorship driven culture where they are either in a mentorship role or being mentored is a recipe for success

Exceptional candidates will have knowledge and/or experience in writing tests for the code they ship and/or some rudimentary understanding of application security as it relates to browser related subjects
An eye for clean and practical user interfaces and experiences is also a bonus
2-3 "years" experience of working with React or at least a deep understanding and the ability to build well-designed components
Significant experience with vanilla JavaScript and CSS
Excellent understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)
Knowledge of browser testing and debugging
Knowledge of browser based application security attacks and mitigation (optional)
Excellent analytical and multitasking skills with an ability to perform well in a dynamic environment
Enough of an education to know what you're doing (however you learned to do what you do)
Responsibilities: If you can jump into the back-end and build out API's and get your hands dirty in the whole stack we love you even more
Developing component based user interfaces for data-driven applications using modern tooling and best practices
Optimize applications for maximum speed and design mobile-based features

data.job_description:
Job Description

Insight Global is looking for Remote Jr., Mid, Sr., and Principal Software Engineers for one of our retail clients in Des Moines, IA. As a Software Engineer, you'll work as a member of a cross functional agile team focused on building great user interfaces and customer facing products. You'll create reusable components that are shared across many application and work with other team members to cross-pollinate ideas and skills. You'll find, monitor, and address performance issue and take features from conception to final production deployment. In the role, you'll contribute heavily to user story definition that takes our technology stack into consideration, but also continue to push the bounds of what is possible. You'll work heavily in a paired programming environment and mentor other engineers. Software Engineers will be working on full stack development with customer facing product but all working on the back end as well.

Openings: 12 Left out of 21

3 Principal Software Engineers

2 Senior Software Engineers

5 Software Engineers II

2 Software Engineers I

Location: Remote - (have to work CST)

DURATION: Permament

Must Haves:
• Hands on experience with React, React Native, Next.js
• Experience with Node and GraphQL
• Experience with cloud - must be willing to work with GCP
• Experience working in Paired Programming

Plusses:
• Retail experience OR B2C experience

Qualifications: Hands on experience with React, React Native, Next.js
Experience with Node and GraphQL
Experience with cloud - must be willing to work with GCP
Experience working in Paired Programming
Retail experience OR B2C experience
Responsibilities: As a Software Engineer, you'll work as a member of a cross functional agile team focused on building great user interfaces and customer facing products
You'll create reusable components that are shared across many application and work with other team members to cross-pollinate ideas and skills
You'll find, monitor, and address performance issue and take features from conception to final production deployment
In the role, you'll contribute heavily to user story definition that takes our technology stack into consideration, but also continue to push the bounds of what is possible
You'll work heavily in a paired programming environment and mentor other engineers
Software Engineers will be working on full stack development with customer facing product but all working on the back end as well

data.job_description:
Latam & USA Contract Mar 17, 2023

Job Description

Softon is a Costa Rican Software Development company with more than 16 years providing tech solutions to our clients with outsourcing and staff augmentation methodologies.

We work along with USA and Canada companies mostly, which gives you the opportunity of growing your career path and putting your English skills into practice.

We offer fully remote freelance and also full-time projects, with schedule flexibility... you don't have to give up your day in order to achieve the company's goals!

As we're always looking for great talent, this time we need React Developers.

Requirements:
• Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
• At least 5+ years with Reactjs development
• Experience with popular React.js workflows
• Familiarity with RESTful APIs
• Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git, SVN, and Mercurial.
• Previous experience with data structure libraries
• Experience with React Hooks.
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or related technical fields

Qualifications: Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles

data.job_description:
Full-Stack React Developer

Who We Are:

Effi is a software development company specializing in live interactive video, where the audience can engage with the content in innovative ways across multiple platforms simultaneously. In addition, Effi is at the forefront of building a world of utility for web3 projects through token-gated experiences that allow customers to market their NFTs, POAPs, and other web3 projects without sacrificing social reach. We’re looking for a full-time React developer to join a small team with shared responsibilities in an agile environment.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with other engineers, the project manager, and the product designer to develop and maintain new features and products
• Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code for frontend web applications (the backend is Rails, and some of the codebase is HTML, JavaScript/StimulusJS, but the frontend on the new products is in React)
• Work with quality assurance team members to troubleshoot and debug issues as needed
• Attend short standup meetings (via Zoom or Google Meet) 3-4 times per week, and use Slack to regularly communicate with the team (ad hoc meetings are more than welcome too!)
• Tools used: Jira, GitHub, Figma, Notion, Slack

Requirements:
• Strong hands-on experience in React
• Strong experience with NextJS, Chakra UI, and Typescript would be preferred
• Experience in Ruby on Rails / StimulusJS is optional but good to have
• Experience with live video, video streaming, and/or interactive video is preferred
• Good eye for design and UI/UX, as well as a strong technical foundation and experience building customer-facing web applications
• Knowledge of, or willingness to learn about, blockchain/web3, smart contracts, and NFTs
• Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced environment
• Very good communication and problem-solving skills
• Very good organizational and time-management skills
• Goal-oriented, with ability to work productively both independently as well as collaboratively

Qualifications: Strong hands-on experience in React
Experience in Ruby on Rails / StimulusJS is optional but good to have
Good eye for design and UI/UX, as well as a strong technical foundation and experience building customer-facing web applications
Knowledge of, or willingness to learn about, blockchain/web3, smart contracts, and NFTs
Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced environment
Very good communication and problem-solving skills
Very good organizational and time-management skills
Goal-oriented, with ability to work productively both independently as well as collaboratively
Responsibilities: Collaborate with other engineers, the project manager, and the product designer to develop and maintain new features and products

Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code for frontend web applications (the backend is Rails, and some of the codebase is HTML, JavaScript/StimulusJS, but the frontend on the new products is in React)
Work with quality assurance team members to troubleshoot and debug issues as needed
Attend short standup meetings (via Zoom or Google Meet) 3-4 times per week, and use Slack to regularly communicate with the team (ad hoc meetings are more than welcome too!)
Tools used: Jira, GitHub, Figma, Notion, Slack

data.job_description:
I have 4 jobs currently as Senior React developer, and looking to get more jobs in upcoming days .

Basically I am looking for someone who can reduce my work load and i am happy to work for life time.

My budget is 8-10usd/hour and i need your 8-10 hours/daily and if you want to work on weekends also, that will be your call !

Basically type of work I get is to fix bugs and do some development.

Only you need to finish up the tasks,Rest I will manage it, i will give you clear requirements in each job so that it would be easy for you to go on.

Thanks happy bidding, please bid only if you can start immediately and happy with 8-10usd/hour charge and ready to go for long term.

Responsibilities: Basically type of work I get is to fix bugs and do some development

data.job_description:
Title: Software Engineer II

Location: Moline, IL

Interview:- Webcam

Description:

Major Purpose:

Works on a product team and supports product design by planning its work, coordinating with others, and writing and testing code to deliver moderately complex functionality on a complete product or significant portion of a product it supports. This level develops simple designs to solve well-defined problems with guidance from more senior team members. May assign, coordinate and review portions of the work to support personnel; Makes decisions within established guidelines subject to review by supervisors; Executes high level applications to more complex problems.

Major Duties:

• Develops, codes, configures, and tests programs and systems.

• Evaluates and implements enhancement design solutions to improve cost, quality, and performance of software applications.

• Analyzes assignments and determines software specifications that must be fulfilled to achieve objectives.

• Executes necessary documentation, as directed, or needed.

• Collaborates with other relevant stakeholders and team members to ensure that features meet business needs.

• Follows industry-standard agile software design methodology for development and documentation.

Skills, Abilities, Knowledge:

• Ability to analyze, translate, and define business requirements into technical solutions.

• Excellence in verbal and written communication forms with emphasis on persuasive communication, tact and negotiation.

• Ability to apply engineering principles and concepts for designs.

• Ability to manage many competing priorities/requests in a fast-paced environment

Education:

• Degree in an Engineering/Technology discipline or equivalent experience. - University Degree (4 years or equivalent)

• Degree in an Information Technology discipline or equivalent experience. - University Degree (4 years or equivalent)

Work Experience:

• Previous experience in programming/software development. (1 - 3 years)

• Software development processes experience. (1 - 3 years)

• Participating in Agile Development (1 - 3 years)

• Experience working in an Agile Environment (1 - 3 years)

• Develops, codes, configures, and tests programs and systems for Internal agile metrics app (ReactJS; NodeJS; TypeScript)

• Design, architect, and build scalable cloud solutions to host virtual dev, qual, and prod application environments

• Supports advanced configuration, integrations, and operations of Agile SaaS tools: Jira (Backlog Management), Mural(Whiteboarding), TeamRetro (Retrospectives), and Quantive(OKRs).

• Evaluates and implements enhancement design solutions to improve cost, quality, and performance of software applications.

• Analyzes assignments and determines software specifications that must be fulfilled to achieve objectives.

• Executes necessary documentation as needed.

• Collaborates with other relevant stakeholders and team members to ensure that features meet business needs.

• Follows industry-standard agile software design methodology for development and documentation.

• Mentors junior software engineers within the team and across multiple products.

• Leads engineering practices alongside engineering manager.

What Skills You Need (Required skills/experiences)

• Ability to advocate for Agile best practices including Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment, Clean Code practices, Scrum methodologies

• Ability to analyze, translate, and define business requirements into technical solutions. - Has an expert understanding of the principles, can apply the information to complex situations, solve complex problems, conduct research/break new ground, develop new applications, and provide expert support for other practitioners.

• Ability to apply engineering principles and concepts for designs. - Has an expert understanding of the principles, can apply the information to complex situations, solve complex problems, conduct research/break new ground, develop new applications, and provide expert support for other practitioners.

• Excellence in verbal and written communication forms with emphasis on persuasive communication, tact and negotiation. - Performs more complex functions, understands principles, may teach others.

• Ability to manage many competing priorities/requests in a fast-paced environment - Performs more complex functions, understands principles, may teach others.

• Hands-on experience designing and developing in React - 4 years

• Hands-on experience designing and developing in JavaScript (TypeScript) and Node.JS - 3 years

• Hands-on experience implementing, testing, and supporting APIs - 3 years

• Hands-on experience implementing, testing, and supporting CI/CD pipelines – 2 years

• Product design, test and/or analysis experience. - 3 years

• Experience in Agile Development - 3 years

What Makes You Stand Out (Desired skills/experiences)

• Fluency in client/server communication patterns

• Expertise in architecting, building, and deployment of scalable and engaging web interfaces

• Expertise in debugging UI issues and performance optimization geared towards user experience

Education

Ideally you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:

• Degree in a Software Engineering/Technology discipline or equivalent experience. - University Degree (4 years or equivalent)

• Degree in an Information Technology discipline or equivalent experience. - University Degree (4 years or equivalent)
• *Glider Assessment will be required.Glider Name and ID# Will be provided when interviews are requested (only candidates who receive an interview request need to take this assessment)**

Excellence in verbal and written communication forms with emphasis on persuasive communication, tact and negotiation
Ability to apply engineering principles and concepts for designs
